banana-oat-pancakes-001.title: Oatmeal Banana Pancakes
banana-oat-pancakes-001.description: Healthy, gluten-free pancakes made with oats and ripe bananas

instructions.step: 1. Blend oats until they become a fine flour. Add remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.
2. Let batter rest for thicker pancakes. Heat non-stick pan over medium heat.
3. Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on surface.
4. Flip and cook other side until golden brown.

tips: Use very ripe bananas for sweetness
Let batter rest for 5 minutes if too thin
Don't overmix the batter
Keep pancakes warm in oven while making the rest

brown-jollof-001.title: Brown Jollof Rice
brown-jollof-001.description: A healthier twist on the classic Nigerian Jollof using brown rice

instructions.step: 1. Blend tomatoes, red bell peppers, scotch bonnets, 1 onion, garlic, and ginger until smooth to make sauce base.
2. Heat oil in a large pot, add diced onion and sauté until translucent.
3. Add blended mixture and cook until oil floats to top and raw smell disappears.
4. Add spices, brown rice, and required water. Bring to boil then reduce to simmer.

tips: Brown rice needs more water than white rice
Let it rest for 10 minutes after cooking
Don't stir too often while cooking
Sauce should be well reduced before adding rice

buns-001.title: Nigerian Buns
buns-001.description: Sweet, golden-brown deep-fried dough balls with crispy exterior and soft interior

instructions.step: 1. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and nutmeg in a bowl. Add eggs, butter, and milk. Mix until you have a thick, smooth dough that's slightly sticky.
2. Heat oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C). Test temperature with a small piece of dough - it should rise to surface and bubble.
3. Scoop dough with hands or spoon and drop into hot oil. Don't overcrowd the pot.
4. Fry until golden brown, turning occasionally for even cooking. Remove and drain on paper towels.

tips: Dough should be thick enough to scoop, not runny
Maintain oil temperature for even cooking
Don't make balls too large - they need to cook through
Test one bun first to check doneness inside

chili-oil-001.title: Chili Oil
chili-oil-001.description: Aromatic and spicy infused oil for seasoning dishes

instructions.step: 1. In a small saucepan, heat oil until it reaches 350°F (180°C). Test temperature by dropping a chili flake - it should sizzle gently.
2. Place chili flakes, star anise, and garlic in a heat-safe container.
3. Carefully pour the hot oil over the spices. The oil should bubble vigorously then settle.
4. Let cool completely at room temperature.

tips: Store in a clean, airtight jar
Keep refrigerated for up to 6 months
Strain oil if desired
Can be used immediately but flavors develop over time

cocoyam-fritters-001.title: Cocoyam Fritters
cocoyam-fritters-001.description: Crispy, spiced cocoyam fritters with a tender interior

instructions.step: 1. Peel and grate cocoyam. Squeeze out excess moisture using a clean kitchen towel.
2. Finely dice onions and pepper. Mix with grated cocoyam, crushed stock cube, and egg.
3. Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Drop spoonfuls of mixture into hot oil.
4. Fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides. Remove and drain on paper towels.

tips: Remove as much moisture as possible for crispy fritters
Don't make fritters too thick - they need to cook through
Maintain oil temperature for even cooking
Serve hot for best texture

fishballs-sauce-001.title: Fishballs in Tomato Sauce
fishballs-sauce-001.description: Tender fish balls simmered in a rich, spicy tomato sauce

instructions.step: 1. Blend fish, egg, and seasonings in a food processor until smooth. Mix in breadcrumbs. Shape into small balls.
2. Blend tomatoes, peppers, one onion, garlic, and ginger for sauce. Dice remaining onion.
3. Heat oil, sauté diced onions until translucent. Add blended sauce mix and simmer until reduced.
4. Gently add fishballs to sauce. Simmer until cooked through.

tips: Keep hands wet when shaping fishballs
Don't stir sauce too vigorously after adding fishballs
Sauce should be thick enough to coat fishballs
Test fishball doneness by cutting one in half

fried-rice-001.title: Nigerian Fried Rice
fried-rice-001.description: Classic Nigerian-style fried rice with mixed vegetables

instructions.step: 1. Cook rice in salted water until firm but done. Spread on tray to cool.
2. Heat oil in a large wok or pot, sauté onions until translucent.
3. Add vegetables and stir-fry until just tender.
4. Add cooled rice, spices, and chicken stock. Stir-fry until well combined and heated through.

tips: Rice must be cooled before frying
Don't overcook the vegetables
Use high heat when frying
Season to taste at the end

herb-oil-001.title: Herb Oil
herb-oil-001.description: Fresh herb-infused oil for dressing and finishing dishes

instructions.step: 1. Blanch herbs in boiling water for 10 seconds, then immediately transfer to ice water. Drain and pat completely dry.
2. Blend herbs, garlic, and oil until completely smooth.
3. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve lined with cheesecloth.

tips: Store in a clean, airtight container
Keep refrigerated for up to 1 week
Bring to room temperature before using
Use on salads, pasta, or as a finishing oil

iwuk-edesi-001.title: Iwuk Edesi (Palm Oil Rice)
iwuk-edesi-001.description: Traditional Nigerian palm oil rice with dried fish and spices

instructions.step: 1. Clean dried fish and soak in hot water. Dice onions and peppers.
2. Heat palm oil until clear, add onions and peppers. Sauté until soft.
3. Add rice, dried fish, crayfish, stock cubes, and required water. Bring to boil.
4. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.

tips: Don't stir too often after adding rice
Palm oil should be clear before adding ingredients
Adjust pepper quantity to taste
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving

maharagwe-nazi-001.title: Maharagwe ya Nazi (Beans in Coconut Sauce)
maharagwe-nazi-001.description: Red kidney beans in a rich coconut curry sauce, East African style

instructions.step: 1. Soak beans overnight. Drain and cook in fresh water until tender but still holding shape.
2. Blend tomatoes, half the onions, garlic, and ginger into a smooth paste.
3. Sauté remaining diced onions until golden. Add curry powder and cardamom, fry until fragrant.
4. Add blended mixture, cook until oil separates. Add coconut milk and cooked beans, simmer until thickened.

tips: Use fresh coconut milk for best results
Don't overcook beans - they should hold their shape
Sauce should be thick but still flowing
Let it rest for flavors to develop

moimoi-001.title: Moimoi (Steamed Bean Pudding)
moimoi-001.description: Smooth, steamed bean pudding with vegetables and eggs

instructions.step: 1. Soak beans overnight, then rub between hands to remove skins. Rinse until water runs clear.
2. Blend beans, peppers, and onions until completely smooth. Mix in oil, crushed stock cubes, and salt.
3. Beat eggs and stir into bean mixture until well combined.
4. Pour into greased moimoi molds or ramekins, cover with foil. Steam in a large pot with water halfway up sides of molds.

tips: Ensure beans are completely smooth when blended
Water shouldn't enter the molds while steaming
Insert a toothpick to test doneness - should come out clean
Can be made in banana leaves for traditional flavor

onion-oil-001.title: Onion Oil

instructions.step: 1. Slice onions thinly. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat until it reaches 300°F (150°C).
2. Add onions to oil and cook until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
3. Strain oil into a heat-safe container. Keep the fried onions for garnish if desired.

tips: Store in a clean, airtight container
Keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks
Use fried onions as a garnish
Great for stir-fries and marinades

sinasir-001.title: Sinasir (Hausa Rice Pancakes)
sinasir-001.description: Traditional fermented rice pancakes with distinctive holes

instructions.step: 1. Soak rice overnight, then blend until smooth. Add yeast and sugar, let ferment for 12 hours.
2. After fermentation, add salt and stir. Batter should be slightly thick but pourable.
3. Heat non-stick pan on medium heat. Pour batter in circular motion from center outward.
4. Cook until holes form and surface is dry. No need to flip.

tips: Rice must be properly fermented for best results
Batter should be smooth with no grains
Pan should not be too hot to allow holes to form
Don't flip the pancakes - they cook on one side only
